intro: Epidendrum neogaliciensis, commonly known as the Neogalician Epidendrum, is a species of orchid native to Central America. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in the understory of tropical forests. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. Epidendrum neogaliciensis is appreciated for its ornamental value and is cultivated by orchid enthusiasts for its beauty and resilience.
